title: Riot, you want buff lux?
body:
You know, that old old old mage that's still pretty solid a pick regardless of who she's against cause she can one shot people with her 30 second cooldown ultimate...yeah that lux? 

Let me start by saying this, lux doesn't need a buff, she isn't OP and that's not what i'm saying. She's still viable but just because she isn't good in high ELO or LCS doesn't mean she needs a buff(to those saying she's bad at high ELO, a lot of champions are.). What lux needed was an update in the mage rework, she's a light mage but honestly only two MAYBE three abilties of her's actually make sense with her design. Like many demacian champions, she's outdated not a lot but enough to warrant looking at for a mini rework. Instead of flat number buff, cooldown changes and other things. Maybe just add more tools to her kit to make her seem less linear/one dimensional and offer more to a team, it should be noted that number's buffs made her broken in LCS not to long ago.

It's not going to have a significant impact because lux cannot hit a competent enemy laner with her ult without them being cc'd. Not ever. She has to land a binding first or have a teamate come gank. Even if she kills you with her ult and then comes back to lane still having her ult, it doesn't effect you at all really unless you let yourself get hit by her binding a second time or you get ganked a second time and locked down again.

In either of these cases where lux actually gets to make use of this 'op cooldown refresh' her enemy was already going to probably die anyway since they seem to be eating bindings or getting ganked over and over.


Once you consider the actual use cases for luxes ultimate as a combat spell instead of waveclear, it's easy to see that a cooldown on ult kill mechanic really doesn't add anything useful to her in lane, and at most is handy for cleaning up teamfights by picking off fleeing enemies... that is to say this buff is only useful when your team has already won a teamfight.

I understand my mistake, but it is clear that Lux is underperforming in Gold+ (outside of Euw, she has 46% Winrate with decent Playrate) and doing well in Bronze/Silver. If there is no way she can be buffed to reward experienced players without making her a 54% Winrate and 20% Pickrate (because most of the playerbase will abuse her, especially in lower tiers), then I don't really see what they can do other than rework her.

Her current buff on the PBE rewards her for using her Ultimate to execute people. This will only help when A) I snipe an enemy champion or B) I land my Q on a squishy champion after I bought a few items. The first situation is a risky one, the opponent being able to dodge/move out of my Ultimate, while the second one implies using my best defensive for a Proactive play, which again is High Risk/High Reward. This makes me think it rewards more the skilled players than the average one.

I prefer a buff to riskier patterns of her kit than just straight out buff her Passive-Aggressive Playstyle of poking with E all game long.

I wouldn't mind a buff like this coupled with making here combo more delayed, or require more for the optimal situation.  As is, if she can land a Q, she can dump her full combo on you, and potentially even a few autos depending on how far away you're rooted.

Something slightly more like would I would like to see is lux's root scaling its duration based on how close the target is to lux, so she'll get only a .75 or maybe 1 second root at max range, but within the closest say, 400 range (slightly over a third) it would root for 2.25 seconds, then make her ult take 1.25 or 1.5 seconds to go off instead of 1 as it is currently, increase the AP ratio from .75 to .9 or so as compensation, and add this refund to ult cooldown if it kills.

Now, obviously I just kinda threw numbers out there to give a sense of what I envision, but the idea is to include more differentiation of skill on behalf of the Lux player rather than: throw Q's until one lands while harassing with E through minions.  Finally land q -> full combo -> dead enemy, or forced them back, repeat again 30 seconds later cause your ult is back up.
